data.strFullDescription:
[b]Fulfill Your Quest For Global Domination[/b]

Paradox Development Studio is back with the fourth installment of the award-winning Europa Universalis series. The empire building game Europa Universalis IV gives you control of a nation to guide through the years in order to create a dominant global empire. Rule your nation through the centuries, with unparalleled freedom, depth and historical accuracy. True exploration, trade, warfare and diplomacy will be brought to life in this epic title rife with rich strategic and tactical depth.

[b]Main Features:[/b]

[h2]Make your own decisions[/h2]Nation building is completely flexible and the possibilities are endless.
[h2]Use your Monarch Power[/h2]Experience the new system of monarch power where your choices are influenced by the caliber of the man or woman you have at the top and will direct the ebb and flow of gameplay.
[h2]Experience history coming to life[/h2]The great personalities of the past are on hand to support you as you make your mark on thousands of historical events.
[h2]Turn the world into your playground[/h2]Enjoy hundreds of years of gameplay in a lush topographical map complete with dynamic seasonal effects.
[h2]Experience the all new trade system[/h2]The trade system adds a new dimension to the great trade empires of the period. Gain control of vital trade routes and make the wealth of the world flow to your coffers.
[h2]Bring out your negotiating skills in a deeper diplomatic system[/h2]Use coalitions, royal marriages and support for rebels and explore the possibilities of the new unilateral opinion system.
[h2]Engage in Cross-platform Multiplayer[/h2]Battle against your friends or try the co-operative multiplayer mode that allows several players to work together to control a single nation with up to 32 players. Featuring improved chat and new matchmaking servers.
[h2]Create your own history & customize your game[/h2]Europa Universalis IV gives you the chance to customize and mod practically anything your heart may desire and uses Steam Workshop.
data.strSnippet: The empire building game Europa Universalis IV gives you control of a nation to guide through the years in order to create a dominant global empire. Rule your nation through the centuries, with unparalleled freedom, depth and historical accuracy.

vecUnachieved.strDescription: Secure a Royal Marriage with another country.
Build up your army to your country's maximum army forcelimit.
Win a war as a secondary participant.
Build up your navy to your country's maximum navy forcelimit.
Win a war without fighting a single battle.

vecUnachieved.strName: The Princess is in this Castle
vecUnachieved.strDescription: As a country that does not start with a female heir, have a female heir while having a Castle in your capital (more advanced fort buildings do not count).

data.item_description: Gustav II Adolf "the Great" ruled Sweden from 1611 to 1632 and was the founder of Sweden as a Great Power. He is called by some the "father of modern warfare", one of the greatest military commanders of all time with his innovative use of combined arms. Sweden rose to one of the great powers of Europe during Gustav II Adolf's reign, and the country became a model of early modern era government.

Elizabeth I reigned England and Ireland from 17 November 1558 until her death in 1603. After a turbulent 25 years, where she was declared illegitimate and imprisoned on suspicion of supporting Protestant rebels, Elizabeth finally became queen when her half-sister Mary died. Queen Elizabeth established an English Protestant church as one of her first move as queen. She never married, thus gaining the nickname "The Virgin Queen".

Louis XIV or "the Sun King" ruled as King of France and Navarre from 1643 until his death in 1715. He sought to create a centralized state governed from the capital and eliminate the remnants of feudalism. Louis XIV's France was the leading European power during his 72 years and 110 days on the throne.

Suleiman I "the Magnificent" ruled for 46 years, from 1520 to his death in 1566. He was also known as Suleiman I "the Lawgiver" as he instituted major legislative changes relating to society, education, taxation, and criminal law. Suleiman I was a patron of culture, who oversaw the Golden age of the Ottoman Empire in its artistic, literary and architectural development. His reign was the apex of the Ottoman Empire's military, political and economic power.

The years between 1444 and 1820 saw many explorers and great inventors. Spain and Portugal explored the world's seas, opening world-wide oceanic trade routes. The New World was discovered and astronomy and science saw major revolutions (like gunpowder...).
